intro: Cymbalaria cymbalaria, commonly known as the common heartwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb characterized by its trailing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, appearing in clusters. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions, often growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Cymbalaria cymbalaria is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
